title: Fatal Bourbon Street gunfight stemmed from 'feud over woman'
content:
NEW ORLEANS -- New details have emerged about a shooting on Bourbon Street last month that left one man dead and nine others hurt.
MORE: NOPD arrests second Bourbon Street Shooting suspect
Prosecutors say the shooting stemmed from an argument over a woman.
One of the suspects, Jordan Clay, told detectives that he shot at Travon Manuel in self-defense after the two had been arguing for weeks over Manuel's girlfriend and a prior relationship she had with Clay.
She is also the mother of Manuel's infant child, according to court records.
MORE: Arrest made in St. Martin Parish for Bourbon Street shooting
Manuel and Clay, both from the Lafayette area, exchanged a volley of shots near Bourbon and Iberville streets about 1:30 a.m. Nov. 27, authorities have said. The melee left nine people wounded and claimed the life of Demontris Toliver, a 25-year-old tattoo artist from Baton Rouge.
Both Clay and Manuel are being held without bail on one count of first-degree murder and nine counts of attempted murder.
Read more from the Advocate: www.theadvocate.com/new_orleans/news/crime_police/article_3cba3b28-bbc0-11e6-9b56-9beedfd2d3a2.html
